name: Frozen Banana Bites
author: Allrecipes Cook
summary: A simple dessert that people love! You can use anything you want in place of the toffee: sprinkles, nuts, cookie crumbs, or whatever!  This is also really good with dark chocolate.
directions: Cover a baking sheet with waxed paper
Spoon a thin layer of peanut butter on top of each banana slice
Insert a toothpick through the peanut butter layer into the banana
Place banana bites onto the prepared baking sheet; freeze for 30 minutes to overnight
Melt chocolate and shortening in the top of a double boiler over simmering water, stirring frequently and scraping down the sides with a rubber spatula to avoid scorching
Cover another baking sheet with waxed paper
Remove 2 to 4 banana bites from the freezer at a time; coat each bite with chocolate mixture
Place coated banana bites on the second baking sheet; sprinkle each with toffee bits
Repeat until all the bites are coated
Return banana bites to freezer until set, at least 1 hour
Allow bites to sit in room temperature for about 15 minutes before serving
